授業目的: “The single greatest cause of difficulties in global business transactions is not a lack of technical expertise, hard work, or good intentions – it is a lack of ‘people skills’ for relating successfully with counterparts from other countries and cultures.” (Working GlobeSmart, Ernest Gundling) As more and more our global markets expand and our workplaces become increasingly multi-ethnic, intercultural understanding and effective communication skills as well as interaction and integration among the people have become critical. In this course, students will develop intercultural competence – the ability to communicate and behave appropriate ways with those who are culturally different focusing on a multicultural business environment. Also this course explores the challenges of working in a culturally diverse work force and the complexities of dealing with different traditions, languages, and value systems in order to collaborate across borders.
到達目標: 1.   To develop skills, knowledge, and attitudes which are needed to function effectively personally and professionally: Skills, Knowledge, and Attitudes2.   To identify cultural gaps, analyze how they affect in business situations, and decide on strategies to bridge those gaps3.   To recognize challenges of working remotely and identify the roots of miscommunication, and learn to minimize the barriers for effective communication
授業方法: ·    Utilize a wide variety of approaches and experiential and interactive activities during the class and focus on student-driven exploration·    Utilize case studies and critical incidents to provide a deeper understanding of the contents and enhance the ability to apply critical thinking·    Work individually, in pairs, or in groups on topics that relate to the contents·    Encouraged to reflect on their learning by writing journal
